text: (upbeat music)
- [Sai] Hello, my name is Sai,

and I'm a senior product
manager at AWS Marketplace.

In this video, I will be
walking you through new features

available today for AWS
Marketplace sellers,
local currency offers, and disbursements.

And I will show you how you
can create private offers
in local currencies.

Previously, AWS Marketplace
sellers could only sell
in US dollars.

Buyers can choose to pay
invoices in local currencies.

However, the invoicing amount
from USD to local currencies

is only visible to the buyer
at the time of invoice receipt.
For deals with future invoicing dates,
and especially multi-year transactions,
buyers face the FX variability risk.
To address these points of friction,

we are rolling out new features
that I'll dive into next.

Let's go over the scope
of what's being launched
in the remainder of this year.

In 2024, we will be enabling
AWS Marketplace sellers

to create private offers
with contract pricing
in four additional currencies

and receive disbursements
in local bank accounts.
More specifically with this launch,

sellers will be able to
create private offers
using Euros, British pounds, Japanese yen,
and the Australian dollar.

Sellers will also be able
to receive disbursements
in that same currency.

Next, sellers will also be
able to receive disbursement

in local bank accounts and
eligible jurisdictions,
like the EU, UK, Australia, or Japan.

Finally, buyers will be
able to procure software
and services from AWS Marketplace

without the current foreign
exchange variability risk,
since they can now be invoiced
in the same currency as the seller.

Now, first we need to
look at how you can use

your local bank accounts
to receive disbursements.

You can use one bank account
to receive disbursements

in multiple currencies or
use multiple bank accounts
and set up each with a separate currency.

If you want to use a bank
account located in the UK,

you must complete your KYC,
or Know Your Customer, process
for AWS EMEA.

Please note that the US ACH
accounts and Hyperwallet
can only receive disbursements in USD.

UK Bank accounts can only
receive disbursements

in EUR and GBP from sales
invoice from AWS EMEA.

If you want to learn more on
how to add local bank accounts

and disbursement methods,
please watch our video
that guides you through the process

of adding bank accounts
and associating currencies.
Now, a few reminders.

Once you have added
your local bank accounts
and set the disbursement methods,
you can now create private offers
with contract pricing in non-USD.

ISVs need to set the resale
authorization in the currency.

A channel partner needs to send
a CPPO in the same currency.

You will also receive
disbursements in the same currency
as defined in the private offer.
Now, I will walk you through a demo

of how you can create a private
offer in local currency,

and I will also show
you how you can create

a resale authorization
for your channel partner
to extend a channel partner private offer.
Once you log into the AMMP portal,

you can set your bank accounts
and disbursement preferences,

including currency association,
under the Settings tab.

This is a prerequisite
before you're able to create
a private offer in a non-USD currency.

To learn more about how you
can create the bank accounts
and associate currencies,
please refer to the video

on adding bank accounts
and associating currency.
Once you have created your bank accounts
in associated currency,
you can now move to the Offers tab

and you can click on
Create Private Offers.
You can continue to create a private offer

by clicking on the Create
Private Offer button,
and then you can select a product type
and the product that you want
to create the private offer in.

You can continue creating
the private offer
the way it is done today.
There is absolutely no difference.
These private offers can be created
using an installment plan,
or you can also pay them upfront.
For the sake of this example,
I'll be using an installment plan.

I'm going to use a
two-month installment plan
as my duration.
This is the new widget that you can see

where you are now able
to select the currency

in which you want to
create a private offer.

You have US dollars followed
by four other currencies

that you have associated
in your Settings tab.

For the sake of this example,
I'll be selecting Euros.
You can select the dimensions,

and then you can also enter
the quantity of the dimensions,
and you can see that the contract total
will now be in the non-USD value.
So now you can enter the price in non-USD.
In this case, it is in euros.
And the number of installments,
so we are having two installments.

For this example, we
generate an installment plan.

You can see all of the
values here in euros.
You can now add the buyer's AWS account ID
to whom you'll wanna extend the offer.
You select the contract,

and you can review and
create the private offer
that you want to extend to your buyer.

The offer currency is
clearly listed here in Euros.
You can see the total euro amount
and the payment amount in euros as well.
Please ensure that the buyer is able
to make a payment in euros,
and this is the currency that you
and the buyer have negotiated to pay in.

With that, you can now
create a private offer,

and the private offer is
now sent to the buyer.

Now I will also show
you how you can create

a resale authorization
for a channel partner.

For this, you need to
click on the Partner tab.
Under the Partner tab,

you click on Create
Reselling Authorization.

You can give a name to
the resale authorization,
a description as it exists today.
You just select a resale authorization
by a seller ID or name.

You can then click on
the individual pricing
or a flexible payment schedule,
and you can select the product type.

And finally, this is
where you will get to see
the currencies you can select
to create a resale authorization.

This should be able to
create a resale authorization

for your channel partner
so that they can extend it
to the end buyer.
This concludes my demonstration
